description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7p4m4","text":"The Vagus nerve innervates a number of thoracic and visceral organs. Exogenous nervous signal, for example, Vagus nerve stimulation (VNS) provides a route to modulating their function for therapeutic purposes. However, the relationship between VNS parameters and organ responses is poorly understood as evidenced by a number of failed human trials, for example, in the heart failure space.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"u6lm","text":"This study will contributes to our understanding of the relationship between VNS parameters and the organ responses. It does so by mapping VNS parameters (at a fine resolution) to their immediate neural and cardiac effects in 2 pigs under anaesthesia.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Pig, Vagus nerve stimulation, Heart, Stimulation Parameters, Evoked compound action potential, Cardiac

parent_collections.title: Protocols for vagus nerve stimulation in anesthetized pigs

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bvnk5","text":"We do the nerve preparation and device implantation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aovdt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"58tha","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1hh6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b9sht","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1r7hp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"di8d2","text":"We validate the quality of the physiological and neural signals. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1ec2i","text":"We do the setup of the BIOS A1 System (electrophysiology).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"604jt","text":"We install vital signs monitoring. [respiratory pressure, ECG, blood pressure]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"271ng","text":"* Install ECG surface electrodes on the right and left front legs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2l9g9","text":" Install the pressure catheter in the femoral artery. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a37su","text":"Cuff installation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bd7al","text":"Installation of cuff A most rostrally (record1)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vhq8","text":"Installation of cuff C most caudally","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74j8u","text":"Installation of cuff B closer to cuff A (record2)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6o5uv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bo01","text":"Distance from the center of cuff A to center of cuff C is 5.4mm. Distance from the center of cuff A to center of cuff B is 1.7mm. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1a065","text":"Load BIOS Neurotool software for neural recording acquisition and stimulation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5a6ul","text":"Place cuff electrodes in saline. Take impedance measurement to confirm system is functional. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6abd6","text":"Once we validated the quality of the data acquisition systems, we start the stimulation protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"15hid","text":"Make incision on the neck and expose 8cm of the left vagus nerve.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5c3o1","text":"Once testing is complete, the animal is terminated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eido8","text":"Visually validate the quality of the vitals. For the ECG, the r-peaks should be clearly visible to ensure a good extraction of the heart rate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b6idq","text":"Neural signals validated using BIOS neural analytics pipeline. Analyses looks for presence of underlying endogenous signals (e.g. respiration), afferent\u003c\u003eefferent velocity spectrum decomposition, among others.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"805hs","text":"Set the the following stimulation parameters in BIOS Neurotool software: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nndt","text":" Pulse width: 500us","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekd1s","text":"Train duration: 5s","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"l1mt","text":"Stimulation shape: monophasic","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fct1s","text":"Polarity: anodic","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bocco","text":"Conduct a grid search by doing the cartesian product of the frequency and current parameters. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bhs9","text":"Frequency: {2Hz, 10Hz, 20Hz, 30Hz}","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":12,"length":21}],"data":{}},{"key":"cd1nt","text":"Current: {0.05mA, 0.5mA, 1mA, 1.5mA, 2.5mA}","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":10,"length":32}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ol7j","text":"After each stimulation, wait for the physiological signals to return to baseline. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"2Hz, 10Hz, 20Hz, 30Hz"},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"0.05mA, 0.5mA, 1mA, 1.5mA, 2.5mA"}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8mb52","text":"Place the pig in supine position and mark incision.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8nvl0","text":"Installation of the vitals monitoring (respiratory pressure, ECG, blood pressure).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Protocol for vagus nerve stimulation in anesthetized pigs (subject-2)
